city.cs.engine

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.World

  • public class World
extends Object
    A world in which the motion and interaction of a number of rigid bodies is simulated. Bodies are added to the world automatically when they are created.

    Quantities in the world are measured using the SI system (metres, kilograms and seconds):

    • Displacements and velocities in the world are represented using the Vec2 class. The two components of a Vec2 are measured in metres, with the x-component increasing to the right and the the y-component increasing upwards.
    • Angles are measured in radians; to convert from degrees to radians, use Math.toRadians().

    Once started, the simulation approximated physical behaviour by computing positions and velocities of bodies at discrete time steps (by default, 1/60 of a second). StepListeners can be registered to invoke application code immediately before and after each simulation step. Once started, the simulation can be paused and unpaused.

    Warning: When the simulation is running, the world should only be modified using the listener interfaces.

    See Also:
    Body.addCollisionListener(city.cs.engine.CollisionListener), Sensor.addSensorListener(city.cs.engine.SensorListener)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the simulation.

      • oneStep

        public void oneStep()
        Advance a paused simulation by one step.

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        Pause or unpause the simulation. When the simulation is paused, it may be advanced one step at a time using oneStep().

        If paused is set on the world during a call to preStep(), the world will enter the paused state immediately after the return from preStep() and the simulation step will not take place.

        Parameters:
        paused - the new value of the paused attribute

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Is the simulation paused?
        Returns:
        the paused attribute

      • getSimulationSettings

        public SimulationSettings getSimulationSettings()
        Get the settings for the physics simulation.
        Returns:
        the settings

      • setGravity

        public void setGravity(float g)
        Set the strength of gravity in this world. The new gravity acceleration vector will act vertically downwards with the specified strength. Setting negative gravity strength causes gravity to act upwards instead of downwards. Note that individual bodies have their own gravity scale attribute (default 1.0f) which is multiplied with the global gravity strength when simulating the effect of gravity on bodies.
        Parameters:
        g - the new gravity strength in metres per second per second
        See Also:
        DynamicBody.setGravityScale(float)

      • addStepListener

        public void addStepListener(StepListener listener)
        Register a listener to be notifed before and after each simulation step. The listener's preStep() method is called immediately before each simulation step. The listener's postStep() method is called immediately after each simulation step. The postStep() methods are called the simulation step has finished and collision listeners have been called.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add
        See Also:
        addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener)

      • removeStepListener

        public void removeStepListener(StepListener listener)
        Unregister a step listener. Does nothing if the listener is not registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove
